### UC Davis DataLab
* The [DataLab](https://datalab.ucdavis.edu/about/) (formerly the Data Science Initiative) offers trainings, seminars, and consultations on a wide variety of data analysis and exploration. 

### Statistics
* [Statistics for Terrified Biologists](http://mtvernon.wsu.edu/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Statistics_for_Terrified_Biologists.pdf)

### Programming in R
* [R-DAVIS](https://gge-ucd.github.io/R-DAVIS/index.html) course offered through the Graduate Group in Ecology
* Weekly [#TidyTuesday Challenges](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday)
* Hadley Wickham's [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html)
* *Fun fact: this website was made in R Markdown [(see here)](website_guide.html), so R is a useful for more than just data analysis!*

### Programming in Python
* [Python Programming for Beginners](https://outschool.com/classes/python-programming-for-beginners-harry-potter-sorting-hat-edition-rlPpH2mv?sectionUid=7a556d9f-7718-4bf4-a142-cd61c88550fb&fbclid=IwAR3_e5WJqoUqRD5TKIwuLmUaZGQdv8oHOjFmQ5xmLW9TMPfeyb2yI3oXNrs#abk7wme1xh) using Harry Potter Examples!

### GIS
* [Getting Started with GIS](https://www.esri.com/training/catalog/57630434851d31e02a43ef28/getting-started-with-gis/#!) via ESRI

### Data Visualzation / Figure Design
* [Data Visualization: A Practical Introduction](https://socviz.co/gettingstarted.html#work-in-plain-text-using-rmarkdown) by Kieran Healy
* [MIT Communication Lab Figure Design](https://mitcommlab.mit.edu/be/commkit/figure-design/)
* [Ten Simple Rules for Better Figures](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1003833)

### Using Version Control / GitHub
* [R-DAVIS guide to setting up a Git repository with RStudio](https://gge-ucd.github.io/R-DAVIS/setting_up_git.html)
* [A Quick Introduction to Version Control with Git and GitHub](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1004668) by Blischak et al. (2016)
* [MIT Communication Lab GitHub Resources](https://mitcommlab.mit.edu/be/commkit/github-resources/)

### Best Practices for Organizing Code
* [MIT Communication Lab Coding Mindset](https://mitcommlab.mit.edu/be/commkit/best-practices-for-coding-organization-and-documentation/)
